post_text:
CVA will reopen under Plan C-Transition protocols. Remote learning (at home) will occur during the 1st four weeks for all students and transition to on-site learning (Plan B), pending a CVA school board re-evaluation of local/state health recommendations and parent feedback. When the at-home remote learning period ends, students will return to CVA for instructions Monday-Thursday. Fridays will be designated as deep cleaning/disinfecting days. Students will remain off-site and continue remote learning.

While on campus, class size will be reduced (10-12 students) to allow social distancing (e.g. 6ft apart). Technology will be used to create virtual learning classrooms on-site. Parents who are still uncomfortable with their children returning to the school building will always have the option to continue remote at home learning. The detailed plan is available on the school's website www.cvatigers.com. Contact the school at 252.939.1958 for more information.

post_text: May 5 is Teacher Appreciation Day. During this time of crisis, our educators have acted as a ‚ÄúLighthouse‚Äù for our students and their families, serving as beacons of light and hope and helping them safely navigate the educational challenges related to COVID-19. Let‚Äôs show our teachers and staff how much we appreciate their love and unwavering commitment to North Carolina‚Äôs public schools by placing a light in a window or turning on an outdoor light at 8:20 p.m. (2020 hrs-military time) on Tuesday, May 5 for 20 minutes. Teachers, thank you for lighting the way for learning for North Carolina‚Äôs K-12 students. #NCLighthouseLeaders
text: May 5 is Teacher Appreciation Day. During this time of crisis, our educators have acted as a ‚ÄúLighthouse‚Äù for our students and their families, serving as beacons of light and hope and helping them safely navigate the educational challenges related to COVID-19. Let‚Äôs show our teachers and staff how much we appreciate their love and unwavering commitment to North Carolina‚Äôs public schools by placing a light in a window or turning on an outdoor light at 8:20 p.m. (2020 hrs-military time) on Tuesday, May 5 for 20 minutes. Teachers, thank you for lighting the way for learning for North Carolina‚Äôs K-12 students. #NCLighthouseLeaders

post_text: In compliance with the executive order (NC school closings) issued by NC Gov. Roy Cooper, CVA will close for two weeks beginning Monday, March 16. Monday and Tuesday (March 16-17) will be required teacher workdays and open for students and parents to pick up any personal or educational items they may need. Parents will also have an opportunity to meet with the teacher to discuss/review the ‚ÄúAt-Home‚Äù I-Ready packets that were sent home and collect students codes for I-Ready online access. More details regarding CVA‚Äôs support services will be provided as more local/state recommendations become available.
text: In compliance with the executive order (NC school closings) issued by NC Gov. Roy Cooper, CVA will close for two weeks beginning Monday, March 16. Monday and Tuesday (March 16-17) will be required teacher workdays and open for students and parents to pick up any personal or educational items they may need. Parents will also have an opportunity to meet with the teacher to discuss/review the ‚ÄúAt-Home‚Äù I-Ready packets that were sent home and collect students codes for I-Ready online access. More details regarding CVA‚Äôs support services will be provided as more local/state recommendations become available.

post_text:
Children's Village Academy will be closed for students and staff members on Thursday, September 5 and Friday, September 6, 2019 due to the dangerous weather conditions associated with the approach of hurricane Dorian. This decision was made based on the consultation with Lenoir County emergency management and with the National Weather Service. On behalf of our Board & all of our staff members, our sincere hope for you and your family is that you will be safe and well during the significant weather challenge.
Thank you.
text:

This decision was made based on the consultation with Lenoir County emergency management and with the National Weather Service. On behalf of our Board & all of our staff members, our sincere hope for you and your family is that you will be safe and well during the significant weather challenge.
Thank you.

post_text:
Good evening.
Children's Village Academy will operate on the same schedule as Lenoir County Public Schools and dismiss at 12:30 pm on Wednesday, September 12, 2018 for all students and staff members. We also will be closed on Thursday and Friday. This decision was made in response to information from the National Weather Service and Emergency Management about the arrival of very strong sustained winds throughout our area late Wednesday afternoon. Our goal is to get all students and staff members home safely prior to the beginning of the dangerous winds and other intense weather. As always, our first priority is the safety of our students and staff members. Thank you and have a great evening.

CVA Administrative Staff

Good Morning!
Children‚Äôs Village Academy will be closed for students today, Tuesday, March 13, 2018. Today will be an optional workday for staff members who determine that they are able to get to work safely later today. Road conditions have been monitored throughout the night by Lenoir County Emergency Management. Most of the roads in the northern parts of Lenoir County still have a great deal of ice and temperatures remain very close to freezing. Many of the bridges and overpasses in all parts of Lenoir County still are covered with ice or have slick spots and patches. We all were hoping to be able to have school as planned today, but the current status of road conditions has not made that possible. Thank you and have a great day.
text:
Good Morning!
Children‚Äôs Village Academy will be closed for students today, Tuesday, March 13, 2018. Today will be an optional workday for staff members who determine that they are able to get to work safely later today. Road conditions have been monitored throughout the night by Lenoir County Emergency Management. Most of the roads in the northern parts of Lenoir County still have a great deal of ice and temperatures remain very close to freezing. Many of the bridges and overpasses in all parts of Lenoir County still are covered with ice or have slick spots and patches. We all were hoping to be able to have school as planned today, but the current status of road conditions has not made that possible. Thank you and have a great day.

post_text:
Good evening students and parents!

Children‚Äôs Village Academy will operate on a two-hour delay schedule for students and staff members tomorrow, Tuesday, March 13, 2018. This decision reflects our desire to make sure that the roads throughout Lenoir and Pitt Counties are completely safe for travel tomorrow morning. We will be monitoring road conditions throughout the night and will be consulting frequently with Emergency Management and the National Weather Service. If a need arises to make additional changes to the schedule for tomorrow, you will receive a notification call by 6:00 am.

Thank you and have a wonderful, safe, & warm evening.

Hi Facebook Friends. It's that time again. Nulook Bounce-N-Party 3rd Annual End of The School Year Party Giveaway! The party is valued at over $1,500 this year! The party will include: Nulook coming to your school setting up inflatable rides, Popcorn machines with supplies, Sno Cone machine with supplies, Clown, Face Painting, plus more..... Nulook staff will do the entire event. To win you have to like Nulook Bounce-N-Party page( like our page if you haven't already liked it) and then post why your school should win the party or just enter your school name in the comment area of the giveaway status. The school that gets the most post and likes will Win!!!. Any school can win K-12. We have items for ALL ages Elementary to High School!!! You have from Wednesday 4/6/16 until Sunday 4/10/16 (12:00 midnight) to post and like!! Winners will be announced Wednesday 4/13/16 at 1:00pm! Show your school Spirit let the Posting and Liking begin. Good luck!

Last year winners
Snow Hill Elementary!
We had a blast!!

The party will include: Nulook coming to your school setting up inflatable rides, Popcorn machines with supplies, Sno Cone machine with supplies, Clown, Face Painting, plus more..... Nulook staff will do the entire event. To win you have to like Nulook Bounce-N-Party page( like our page if you haven't already liked it) and then post why your school should win the party or just enter your school name in the comment area of the giveaway status. The school that gets the most post and likes will Win!!!. Any school can win K-12. We have items for ALL ages Elementary to High School!!! You have from Wednesday 4/6/16 until Sunday 4/10/16 (12:00 midnight) to post and like!! Winners will be announced Wednesday 4/13/16 at 1:00pm! Show your school Spirit let the Posting and Liking begin. Good luck!

Last year winners
Snow Hill Elementary!
We had a blast!!

post_text: It is with great sadness that we say goodbye to such an extraordinary educator. Mrs. Lindel Jones will be missed by her CVA family and friends. A lot of hearts are heavy today, but we are grateful for being blessed with her love and presence for so many years. She was more than a teacher, she was an inspiration to many. Her devotion, calm demeanor, and poise were qualities to admire. We would like to express our deepest condolences to the Jones family.
